title: Can i be sued by a bailbonds for not finishing my payments on my bond, its been more than 7 years?
question: So i was unfortunate to be in a situation of wrong place wrong time so a friend bailed me out. I never finished my payments for my bond, its been more than 7 years can they still file a lawsuit? From my understanding there is a statue of limitation that someone has 4 years to file from day last payment
answers:
Yes, they can still file a lawsuit against you. If that happens you would need to be proactive and file a timely response raising any defenses you have. If you cannot afford to defend the lawsuit or cannot afford to payback the bond then bankruptcy may be the best and most economical option.

Most bonds are just like contracts and most contracts can be eliminated in bankruptcy. Bankruptcy provides relief to the debtor by absolving them of the legal obligation to payback the agreed upon amount under the terms of the contract or bond.

Once bankruptcy is filed the automatic stay prevents the bond company from pursuing you for the debt owed and once the bankruptcy discharge order is entered, the order legally forbids any collection of that bond debt.

If you need help with this then you should contact a bankruptcy lawyer.

I hope this was helpful.

There may be an alternative for you. Depending on your overall financial situation, Bankruptcy may be right for you. An experienced CA Bankruptcy attorney will be able to determine which type of Bankruptcy, if any is the correct one for you. Use AVVO's Find a Lawyer tool to select a qualified attorney. Good luck. Yes, you can be sued even if the statue of limitations as run. The SOL is a defense you must raise in court. The court won't do it for you.
